meanings.definition: To slide or collapse into itself in sections, as a telescope or a pantograph does.
meanings.sent1: She watched the telescope telescoping down to its smallest size.
meanings.sent2: He telescoped the antenna to make it more compact.
meanings.sent3: The collapsing telescope looked like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas telescoped into a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The telescope's telescoping action fascinated the children.

meanings.sent1: He was telescoping his speech to fit the time limit.
meanings.sent2: The editor had to telescope the article to make it fit the page.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she could telescope time to finish her work early.
meanings.sent4: His excitement telescoped into a quick dance of joy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation was clear and telescoped the complex topic.

meanings.definition: To make a series of adjustments so that something can fit into a limited space.
meanings.sent1: They were telescoping the furniture to fit it through the narrow doorway.
meanings.sent2: The engineer had to telescope the design to meet the size requirements.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to telescope the ingredients to fit them all in the pot.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was so tight that she had to telescope her tasks.
meanings.sent5: The team had to telescope their plans to make them work in the small room.
